definition[0]: to put or spread something quickly or carelessly onto a surface
example[0]: She ran upstairs and slapped on some make-up.
example[1]: We could slap some paint on it.
definition[1]: to suddenly announce a new charge, tax etc or say that something is not allowed – used especially when you think this is unfair
example[2]: Many tour operators slap on supplements for single people.
example[3]: In 1977, the president slapped a ban on the commercial reprocessing of nuclear fuel.
